meanings.definition: Having pages numbered on one side only.
meanings.sent1: The folioed book had numbers on just one side of each page.
meanings.sent2: The folioed document was easy to navigate with its numbered pages.
meanings.sent3: I found a folioed notebook, but it only had numbers on the front of the pages.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a folioed book, each memory neatly numbered on one side.
meanings.sent5: The folioed pages were like a trail of breadcrumbs through the story.

meanings.definition: A sheet of paper folded once to form two leaves or four pages.
meanings.sent1: She wrote her letter on a single folioed sheet of paper.
meanings.sent2: The folioed page contained a beautiful poem on both sides.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally tore the folioed paper while trying to fold it neatly.
meanings.sent4: The folioed leaf held secrets within its neatly folded corners.
meanings.sent5: The folioed sheet was like a tiny book waiting to be filled with words.

meanings.definition: To number the leaves of a book or manuscript.
meanings.sent1: The librarian folioed the ancient manuscript carefully.
meanings.sent2: She folioed the pages to keep track of the historical document.
meanings.sent3: He folioed the book with such precision that every page had a number.
meanings.sent4: Folioed with care, the pages of the diary revealed a hidden code.
meanings.sent5: The author would folio the pages before sending the manuscript to the publisher.
